intro: Stenorrhynchos papulosum, commonly known as the rough-stemmed daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and cylindrical stems. The plant features narrow, hairy leaves and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
